Description: Bronze plastic lamp in the form of an elephant's head, the hinged lid modelled as an armoured rider wearing a cuirass and Thracian helmet. The nozzle (now broken) projected forward; the elephant's trunk curves away to the right, its tip lost. The tusks are lost; they were made of iron and inserted separately. At the rear are stumps of a double rod-handle, curving upwards. The base is formed by the elephant's neck, and is almost circular and sunken within.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3574)
Exhibition history: 2023 4 May - 13 Aug, London, BM, G35, Luxury and Power: Persia to Greece
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Daniel Marie Fouquet (sale)
